document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Palaearctic genera of Saprininae (Coleoptera: Histeridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Palaearctic genera of Saprininae (Coleoptera: Histeridae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Saprinus Erichson, 1834: 172
. Type species:
Hister nitidulus Fabricius, 1801
, designated by
Westwood (1838) : 22
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Plesiosaprinus : HOULBERT & MONNOT (1923): 72 ( nomen nudum ). Synonymized by COOMAN (1947) : 428.

Differential diagnosis. Differs from the subgenus
Hemisaprinus
by the absence of pre-apical foveae (well developed in
Hemisaprinus
) and from the subgenus
Phaonius
by the differntly structured antennal club and asetose flattened or only slightly convex prosternal process (see also Key to the subgenera).

Biology. See Biology of
Saprinus
s. l.

Distribution. See Distribution of
Saprinus
s. l.

Species examined.
